intro: Beilschmiedia kweichowensis, commonly known as the Kweichow beilschmiedia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to China, specifically found in the Yunnan and Guizhou provinces. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
